reference.title: LwDITA universal attribute group
reference.shortdesc: The universal attribute group defines a set of common attributes that are available on most XDITA and HDITA components, and have limited equivalence in MDITA components. The universal attribute group includes all attributes from the ID, metadata, and localization attribute groups, plus the class attribute.

HDITA: The outputclass attribute is expressed using the HTML5 attribute class. Authors combining XDITA (or DITA 2.0) and HDITA as formats for content creation in a single project or repository should (do we need RFC-2119?) be careful not to confuse this HDITA attribute with similarly named class in XDITA, which does not have a direct equivalent in HDITA.

MDITA: The outputclass attribute is only available in the topic and section components, and is expressed using a value for the attribute preceded by a period and enclosed in curly brackets following the Pandoc heading identifier syntax. (Need to link to a topic with syntax and example?).
